1. Summary View of the Solution Proposed

This initiative aims to deliver a One-Time-Purchase (OTP) capability experience across HelloFresh Group brands. As of June 2025, across HelloFresh, several use cases had been identified‚Äîsuch as event-themed seasonal boxes, curated selections of specialized items (e.g., premium meat and seafood from Good Chop), items from a broader marketplace of third-party CPG brands, or ready-to-eat meals from sister brands like Factor‚Äîas standalone purchases, without the necessity of an active weekly meal kit subscription for that particular transaction (though OTP may also complement existing subscriptions).

The solution involves creating a seamless OTP user flow within each participating brand's digital platform. This includes clear product discovery for OTP-eligible items, transparent pricing and benefits, distinct OTP cart[a] and checkout processes, appropriate order management for both new and existing customers (subscribed, paused, or cancelled), and downstream capabilities such as delivery management and data.

This foundational OTP capability will initially be piloted and rolled out for:

1. 2025 Initiative Rollouts: 

   1. Seasonal Boxes across HelloFresh (similar to the ANZ model but integrated).

   2. Good Chop offerings for both prospects and actives.

   3. Factor Form item based OTP purchase

2. 2026 Potential Targets:

   1. A 2-Way Marketplace on a selected HelloFresh brand (e.g., Green Chef US pilot) (potential PoC in Q4 2025) 

   2. Cross-selling of Factor meals (as OTP) (iteration on the ‚ÄúOpt-in‚Äù Market Integration Model)

   3. Further discovery might include Factor B2B using the new functionality.

2. Problems Being Solved

Limited purchasing flexibility of current HFG services discourages prospects looking to explore a new service for themselves and their household (OTP orders in funnel, trial boxes) or for past customers looking for greater flexibility without the subscription commitment (reactivation, one-time box offers). Further opportunities to capture new use cases in exploring non-box-add-on marketplace opportunities (Dropship expansion) as well as offering gift boxes (bundles, care packages) easily. 

Today, brands are resorting to either third-party tools (e.g. Shopify) or internal legacy systems (Evangelist), to enable these functionalities and consolidating them through OTP services would significantly lower costs and operational complexity. This OTP functionality is designed to cater to a variety of customer needs and scenarios across HFG brands, complementing existing subscription models. It is, including:

* Seasonal Boxes: Enabling customers to purchase from special seasonal box offers on HelloFresh (eg. AU/NZ Christmas Box); on top of their existing subscription easily through the core HF experience. Past solutions have poor customer experience and technical challenges (being built through abusing existing subscription architecture). 

* Product Trial: Allowing new customers to experience a brand's quality and service (e.g., Good Chop, Factor meals) before committing to a recurring plan. 

* One-off/ Unplanned Needs: Enabling existing or past subscribers to make additional purchases outside their subscription cycle for special occasions, to stock up, to try specific items without altering their core subscription, or to supplement their meal kits with ready-to-eat options or other grocery staples.

* Expanded Assortment & Discovery: Providing access to a wider range of products, including those from third-party vendors via a 2-way marketplace (e.g., snacks, pantry items, specialty goods) and cross-sold items from other HelloFresh Group brands (e.g., Factor meals).

* Gifting: Providing an easy mechanism for customers to purchase products (bundled items, care packages, etc.) as gifts for others.

3. Business Value of Solving This Problem (Combined OTP)[b]

OTP unlocks customers not wanting subscriptions, for trial, gifts, or special occasions. Good Chop OTP experiments in Funnel estimate a potential ‚Ç¨2.7M-‚Ç¨3M in TCVA Seasonal box OTP is estimated at ‚Ç¨16.5M-‚Ç¨21.5M net revenue potential. The 2-Way Marketplace PoC (limited scope) projects ~$2.5M-$4.3M TCVA. The overall OTP opportunity is projected at ‚Ç¨24.7M-‚Ç¨28.8M in incremental TCVA.[c][d][e]

This capability allows existing subscribers to add OTP items, Factor meals, or marketplace products to their regular orders or make additional purchases, boosting overall spend and engagement. Factor cross-sell alone projects an AOV increase of 0.8-1.2pp and potential AOR increase of ~5%. 

4. High Level Solution Breakdown (Here for more detail)

* Core Purchase & Checkout Experience (P0 - Must Have): Enabling customers to easily select one-time purchase (OTP) products, understand their full cost upfront, and complete their orders.

* Operational & Backend Integration (P0 - Must Have): Ensure that customers' OTP orders are processed efficiently behind the scenes, from inventory management to delivery.

* Enhanced Flexibility for OTP (P1 - High Priority): Offering greater convenience and more flexible options, such as guest checkout, basic customization, and the ability to manage their OTP orders.

* Marketplace & Cross-Sell Specifics (P1 - High Priority): Providing customers with access to a wider variety of products, including those from third-party vendors (marketplace) and sister brands like Factor, for one-time purchase.

* Advanced Customization for OTP (P2 - Medium Priority): Giving more control to both customers and internal teams, such as enabling customized boxes, real-time updates on product availability and marketing tools to create unique OTP offerings.

* Future Enhancements (P3 & P4 - Low Priority): Enhance post purchase experience, including easy reorder and combining OTP orders with existing subscriptions.

Project Overview (2025)

The overarching one-time purchase strategy includes several core initiatives for 2025, with an initial focus on:

Good Chop (goodchop.com) One-Time Purchase (OTP):

* Goal: Address customer feedback about subscription hesitation and improve reactivation rates by integrating on-demand purchasing as a core offering.

2. MVP Functionalities for One-Time Purchase (OTP) Capabilities Across HelloFresh Group Brands:[h][i]

Based on the detailed user stories and acceptance criteria for Good Chop, Seasonal Boxes and VMS; here are the key functionalities the technical team needs to build:

1. SKU Management:

   * Explanation: The system needs to allow for the creation and management of distinct OTP products (SKUs) that can have different sizes, prices.

2. Menu Configuration:

   * Explanation: The system needs the ability to differentiate menus (e.g., specific cuts for Good Chop, pre-set menu for seasonal box, no individual recipe purchases for seasonal boxes).

3. Account Creation & Login:

   * Explanation: The system needs to handle various user states ‚Äì new customers requiring registration, existing non-subscribed customers logging in, and active/paused subscribers using existing credentials ‚Äì to facilitate a smooth flow into the OTP purchase journey. 

4. Distinct OTP Checkout Process:

   * Explanation: A dedicated checkout flow for OTP orders is required to ensure clarity on one-time costs for prospects, actives and cancelled. This includes displaying transparent, itemized final pricing (box, shipping, discounts, taxes) and supporting all existing payment methods. 

5. Delivery & Address Management:

   * Explanation: The system must support configurable delivery dates and windows specific to OTP orders[j], which may differ from subscription cut-off times. It needs to handle new address inputs, pre-fill addresses for existing customers, and perform zip code validation for delivery eligibility. 

6. Automated Order Confirmation & Tracking:

   * Explanation: The platform needs to automatically send comprehensive order confirmation emails with full OTP order details, pricing, and delivery information. It must also provide subsequent notifications with tracking information once items ship, and enable logged-in users to view OTP order status and history. [k][l]

7. Customer Care & Internal Order Management (BOB & OWL Integration):

   * Explanation: Customer care agents require access to OTP order details through their backend system (BOB) to perform various actions like order cancellation, delivery rescheduling, address changes, and voucher adjustments. There should also be accessible FAQ content for OTP orders. 

8. Backend Operational & Financial Data Integration:

   * Explanation: All OTP order data must be accurately captured, categorized, and integrated into backend systems (e.g., Katana) for inventory management, fulfillment differentiation (e.g., identifying OTP orders to avoid attaching subscription freebies), logistics, and financial reporting, ensuring proper revenue recognition. 

9. Data & Analytics Capabilities:

   * Explanation: Frontend and backend data for OTP orders need to be correctly captured and categorized on data tables, and then included in major Tableau dashboards with identifiable filters, to enable insights and performance monitoring. 

10. CRM (list of events):

   * Explanation: CRM are able to read OTP orders and send transactional emails such as order confirmation and delivery tracking.

11. Subscription Conversion Flow:

   * Explanation: For Good Chop, the system should facilitate a seamless process for OTP users to convert to a subscription, allowing a subscription order to be created alongside the OTP order without impacting it, and potentially applying specific conversion benefits.

12. [Decided not for MVP] Benefit Application:

   * Explanation: The platform must support discounts for OTP products versus subscriptions. This involves the capability to auto-apply vouchers based on entry points or allow manual entry, with benefits configurable for single box discounts or free shipping, ensuring no interference with existing subscription benefits.

13. [Decided not for MVP] Multiple Order Capability:

[m]

   * Explanation: The system needs to support multiple orders at the same time, whether that‚Äôs a combination of OTP and Subscription order, or multiple OTP orders.

   * For VMS only : Customers can checkout a combination of OTP and subscription product at one go

2. Where We Want to Be: The Grand Vision and Plan to Scale OTP

The long-term vision is to transition to an enhanced single-tier model anchored by flexibility, expanding our offerings to all customer states.

A. Redefining Customer Engagement

We are working toward blurring the distinction between "active" and "canceled" status, viewing customers as simply "ordering in a given week" or "not ordering in a given week". This recognizes that OTP purchases and subscriptions should be considered at the same level in the future.

B. Scaling Audience and Use Cases (The Plan to Scale OTP)

The One-Time Purchase initiative is structured around three key strategic use cases designed to maximize customer lifetime value and expand market reach:

1. Integrate OTP into Core HelloFresh Journeys: Establish OTP as a core, complementary offering alongside the subscription box. This pillar focuses on making the flexible purchase option available across all customer states: Prospects, Actives, and Former customers.

2. Unlock New Consumption Occasions: Expand the OTP platform to support non-subscription purchase opportunities. This includes high-value, complementary use cases like Occasion-Based Boxes (e.g., holiday or seasonal boxes), VIP/Gifting Orders, and Donation Boxes.

3. Expand Across the Brand Portfolio: Leverage the foundational OTP architecture to enable transactional purchasing for other HelloFresh brands. The initial focus will be on Factor Form and Good Chop as the MVPs, with plans to extend the capability to other brands like Chefs Plate and Youfoodz in 2026.

Currently working with the Global Strategy team and Growth team to finalize use cases and markets.

Good[ag] Chop One Time Purchase

Good Chop has previously explored One-Time Purchase (OTP) options to address customer feedback about subscription hesitation and to improve reactivation rates, with past experiments showing significant short-term conversion lifts despite lower long-term retention compared to traditional subscriptions. Recognizing that many customers are skeptical of commitments and seek greater flexibility and control, the new Good Chop experience aims to expand market share by integrating on-demand purchasing as a core offering. 

Good Chop OTP Milestones:

* [MVP - Milestone 1] [ETA W51‚Äô 25] One-off boxes for prospects customers. Good Chop would be offering prospects who do not want a commitment upfront, one time purchase options with value differentiation (with less to no discounts).

   1. Ability to discover and browse OTP products as a prospect on Good Chop pre-checkout funnel

   2. Ability to complete checkout for OTP orders on Good Chop pre-checkout funnel

   3. Ability to receive order confirmation and track delivery

   4. Ability for customer care to support OTP orders

   5. Ability for internal operations, logistics, and finance teams to process and manage OTP orders

   6. Ability to convert OTP users to a subscription





* [Milestone 2] [ETA Q4‚Äô 25] One-off boxes for active customers. Good Chop would be encouraging orders from Actives who might want an additional box outside of their regular cadence (e.g. last minute bbq box for a specific weekend)

2. P0 (must have) requirements

2.1 Milestone 1 (GoodChop, September 2025)





[Checkout]

System allows logged-in users with paused subscriptions to access an OTP purchasing section/flow, select items, and checkout without triggering full subscription reactivation. Order confirmation and delivery are specific to this OTP order.





[Checkout]

System allows active subscribers to place an OTP order as a distinct transaction. The OTP order should have its own delivery scheduling options (if different from the regular subscription) and payment process. It should not interfere with their regular subscription unless an explicit choice is made by the user to combine or replace (future feature).









3. P1-3 requirements









[Cancellation]

System provides a self-service option for customers to manage their OTP orders up to the defined OTP cut-off time for that specific product/campaign.

Priority: P1, All





[Repurchase]

For logged-in customers, the system provides a clear order history that includes OTP purchases. An option to "reorder" or "buy again" for a previous OTP product should be available if that product is currently available for OTP.

Priority: P1, All





[Checkout as a customer - App, Web (x3) - reuse checkout details]





[Gifting]

System allows the customer to specify a different shipping address from their billing address during OTP checkout. A simple "this is a gift" checkbox could hide pricing on the packing slip.

Priority: P2, All

(Is it really a P1?)





[Gifting]

During the OTP gifting flow, after specifying the recipient's address, the system provides an option to type a short personalized message. This message would be printed on the packing slip or a separate small card.

Priority: P3, All





[Guest Checkout]

System offers a guest checkout path for OTP orders, collecting only essential information required to process and fulfill the order. Option to create an account post-purchase should be available.

Priority: P3, All













Benefits:

   * Benefits creation

   * To apply you need a subscription

   * Wallet needs to handle OTP (4-6 weeks)

   * Old end point Voucher Validation Service ‚Äì Hacky solution, could break something else

   * Cannot commit for September, start around October

   * Pricing

üéÅ Experience: HF Seasonal Boxes

Hello Fresh Seasonal Boxes

HelloFresh Group's seasonal box offerings, traditionally sold as one-off purchases through separate microsites and unconnected operational flows, have historically faced significant challenges including declining sales, a poor user experience requiring customers to re-enter details and preventing seamless order tracking, and substantial operational overhead due to disconnected systems. Recognizing the significant market opportunity for festive and occasion-based offerings, the new One-Time-Purchase (OTP) initiative aims to overcome these limitations by integrating seasonal boxes directly into the core HelloFresh experience.





Useful resources:

   * Seasonal boxes and one-off ordering capability 2024 & beyond proposal

   * ANZ Christmas Box: https://christmas.hellofresh.com.au/

   * [ANZ] Christmas Box Kick-Off_2025

[MVP] Requirements for Hello Fresh Seasonal Boxes

   1. Ability to discover and browse OTP products for Seasonal Boxes

   2. Ability to complete checkout for OTP orders for Seasonal Boxes

   3. Ability to receive order confirmation and track delivery

   4. Ability for customer care to support OTP orders

   5. Ability for internal operations, logistics, and finance teams to process and manage OTP orders

As a new or existing HF customer, I want to easily find and access the Seasonal Boxes experience through various entry points, so that I can easily discover and start exploring the seasonal box options.

	   * Seasonal box experience is accessible via a direct landing page/microsite

   * External entry points

   * CRM communications

   * SEO 

   * Paid advertisements

   * In-app entry points

   * In-app banners

   * Notification Center

	



	1.b. Seasonal Boxes Microsite ‚Äì example

As a new or existing HF customer, I want to access the Seasonal Boxes microsite, and see a list of available box options, so that I can easily choose a suitable seasonal box and understand its availability.

   * If open through an in-app link, then it‚Äôll open a web-app within the HF app

   * Homepage list the available pre-set seasonal box sizes and variants (e.g., classic, seafood, different portion sizes)

   * All boxes presented are One Time Purchase only

   * The products are purchasable for a limited period only, (for eg. from Oct to Dec, for Christmas)

   * If customer access during off period, a generic message on off-season is presented

	



	1.c. Product/ Box Selection

As a new or existing HF customer, I want to be able to choose from multiple Seasonal Box options, so that I can select a seasonal box that fits my needs and preferences.

   * Each box option is setup as as separate SKU_id on CCM[bb][bc]

	1.d. Voucher Application

3. Priorities for User Stories

Priorities are assigned above within the user story table (P0 - P4).

   * P0 - Must Have: Core functionalities essential for launching a basic, viable, and legally compliant OTP service across all initial use cases. Includes fundamental purchase flows, clear pricing, order fulfillment integration (including basic drop-ship and cross-brand logic), and handling of different customer states.

   * P1 - High Priority: Features that significantly enhance the customer experience, operational viability, or initial commercial success. Includes guest checkout, basic customization/gifting, self-service order management, and core functionality for marketplace discovery and Factor OTP purchase.

   * P2 - Medium Priority: Important features for expanding customization, improving discoverability, providing better marketing/merchandising tools, and enabling core vendor/cross-brand operational capabilities.

   * P3 - Low Priority: Valuable additions for customer convenience, repeat OTP business, enhanced gifting, and more robust marketplace/cross-sell support.

   * P4 - Nice to Have: Complex features offering incremental benefits but are not critical for the core OTP value proposition and require significant cross-functional effort.

Problem Statement

Social media has become a primary hub for culinary inspiration, where people turn to influencers to discover new recipes. While Followers struggle to find the necessary ingredients and an easy way to re-cook them, Influencers look for new revenue streams to be more independent from the heavily controlled platforms and find new ways to expand their reach and engage with their audiences authentically and organically via food.





Opportunity:

Hellofresh sees a huge opportunity to serve both: by transforming influencers' inspiration (recipe) into a shoppable, cookable meal kit for the consumers. 

By bridging the gap as the Expert in operation, warehouses and logistics, we provide customers a way to enjoy these recipes easily and the influencer to serve their followers and create a new revenue stream. The social commerce market is growing rapidly and can represent a huge opportunity for us to attract new customers.





Why now:

We see the urgency to act now, because influencers are already trying to solve this problem with links to ingredient orders  via Instacart or Pinterest partners with Instacart to enable 1-click grocery list generation from saved pins. But today, shoppable content on social media within the food category is often limited to individual food items as opposed to a holistic offering where the ingredients for entire recipes and direct delivery can be purchased. 





The Core Ask 

WBD: Influencer Marketplace

Explore desired and viable vision for a curated recipe creator marketplace (1. influencer, 2. Aggregators) with the option of an  instant purchase as a meal kit ‚Äòfulfilled by HelloFresh‚Äô.





Long-term Vision (Later) 

Transform HelloFresh into the ‚ÄúSpotify for food‚Äù  a platform where any creator can share a recipe that HelloFresh fulfills.

Gemini Transcript: Influencer Marketplace Catchup - 2025/12/02 11:57 EST - Notes by Gemini





The discussion primarily focuses on the strategy and immediate next steps for the Influencer Marketplace MVP (Minimum Viable Product), with an emphasis on product development flow, technical implementation, and influencer management/research.





1. MVP Strategy & Product Development Flow

Point

	Owner/Follow-up

	Summary

	Decision/Action

	Stakeholder Communication Strategy

	Sameer 

(Action: Create initial starting point for discussion)

	Previous approaches of showing high-fidelity screens early led stakeholders to focus on visuals (e.g., "this button looks ugly") instead of the core customer journey/promise.

	Decision: 

                                          * Future discussions will focus on customer journey alignment first. 

                                          * Low/high-fidelity screens will only be shown after the customer journey is agreed upon and backed by research.

	MVP Focus

	Sameer 

(Action: Define MVP scope for the platform)

	Determine the scope of the MVP to ensure a focused effort and quick build.

	Decision: 

                                          * The MVP will be consumer-facing and managed (HelloFresh creates everything for the influencers). Scaling the supply side (open platform) will happen after proving the business case with consumers.

	Product Requirements Document (PRD)

	Annette

Sameer needs input and help from Annette/team

	Need to formalize requirements to start building.

	The PRD will be generated once the customer journey is aligned and all decisions are backed by existing research, including rationale 



(‚ÄúSo and you know why we are taking some decisions, what is the rationale behind it and which is where you know I need a lot of input and help. So we do that and that would give us our product requirements document for us to start building on it.‚Äù)

	Existing "Cookbook" Tool Integration

	Sameer/Annette (Investigate feasibility)

	The DAU team has built a tool that converts video URLs into HelloFresh recipe cards (ingredients/steps).

	Decision/Action: 

                                          * Explore using the same code/tool for the Influencer Marketplace MVP to significantly reduce manual effort for recipe creation from influencer videos.

	











2. Technical Implementation & Platform

Point

	Summary

	Decision/Action

	Rationale/Context

	Platform Choice (Internal vs. Shopify)

	Discussed whether to build the consumer-facing store (similar to the Christmas Box) on Shopify or internally.

	Decision: Lean on building internally using existing HelloFresh components/platform.

	Shopify setup is complex. Internal build allows for a small, defined MVP scope and reuse of existing Christmas Box code.

	Christmas Box Platform Limitations

	The existing Christmas Box store (built by Sameer) has back-end limitations: only one box per order flow, complex recipe configuration, no add-on purchases, and no voucher capability.

	Action/Context: The team (Do and others) are already working to solve these limitations in Q1. If solved, the front-end can be reused and quickly tweaked for the Influencer Marketplace.

	Familiarity with the existing front-end (created by Sameer/Vander) makes quick adjustments possible.

	Creator-Side Tools (Future Scalability)

	Discussed tools needed for an unmanaged, scalable marketplace (post-MVP).

	Tools needed include: Automated recipe card creation from video, Costing mechanism exposure for influencers to understand product cost, and Analytics/Trends dashboards (like Shopify) for content inspiration and performance tracking.

	This is important for the long-term vision to move from a managed to an unmanaged, true two-way marketplace.

	







3. Influencer Management & Research Concerns





Point

	Summary

	Decision/Action

	Context/Learning

	Ingredient & Fulfillment Limitations

	Concern about whether HelloFresh can fulfill the unique/non-standard ingredients influencers use (e.g., specific spices, products).

	Action: Sameer needs to speak with the physical product team to understand their capability to create or source new ingredients/spice mixes.

	Influencers are highly concerned about the quality and specific ingredients matching their videos.

	Influencer Recipe Adaptation

	Will influencers be willing to change their recipes/videos to fit HelloFresh's standard assortment?

	Finding (from Research): Influencers are more likely to create specific new dishes for the marketplace, based on what they know HelloFresh can fulfill or what consumers are searching for (using analytics/trends data).

	This avoids having to recut existing video content to match ingredient swaps. They want to see the assortment early in onboarding.

	Marketing and Legal

	Need to outreach to specific influencers, and legal needs to create contracts for the MVP phase.

	Action: Sameer will sync with the local HelloFresh Canada marketing team (and potentially Col Banning) to drive the influencer recruitment and contract process.

	A nice platform is useless if no influencers are there ("if nobody's there, it's a problem").

	Research Handover & Next Steps

	Discussed the transfer of knowledge from the current research team (Annette/Katy) to the product team (Sameer).

	Decision: Sameer wants the team to continue working together (even with occasional conversations) because key learnings and context are often missed in formal documentation.

	The team is concentrating on the creator view as it is completely new territory compared to the standard transactional consumer view.

Influencer Marketplace Review // Nov 19th 2025





Authors: Annette MvdE, Katheryn Eckles

Last updated: Nov 20, 2025





Meeting Notes by gemini

 Influencer MP: Sprint Review - 2025/11/20 15:59 CET - Notes by Gemini









Research Findings

	Discussion and Strategic Next Steps

	Driver

	I. Influencer Challenges and Time Constraints

                                                                                                                                 * Significant struggle with managing platform algorithms (TikTok/Instagram) and keeping up with constant trends

	Platform Design & Usability: The new platform must be designed to avoid being a "time suck" to maximize influencer engagement, as time is a major constraint.

	



	II. Demand for Data and Analytics

                                                                                                                                 * Strong desire for more visibility into search term data ("creator search insights"), top-selling recipes, conversion rates, and quality feedback (scores/ratings).

	Feature Development: The platform needs to provide robust data and analytics tools to help creators adapt their recipes and content.

	Annette MvdE

Tech team

	III. Monetization Model Hesitancy

                                                                                                                                 * Influencers are comfortable with flat-fee brand partnerships and fear the necessary work for a commission-based model to be worthwhile.

                                                                                                                                 * Creators expect an entry/posting fee followed by commission, fitting the model into their current business.

	Business Development & Education: Future interviews and marketing materials must reframe the value proposition away from the existing flat-fee brand deal paradigm.

                                                                                                                                 * Strategies include creating a two-pager comparing the two models, emphasizing passive income from evergreen recipes, and using MVP data to show earning potential.

                                                                                                                                 * Consider offering a flexible compensation model (initial flat rate, later switch to commission) and providing detailed sales forecasting data.

	Business

	IV. Value Proposition and Customer Perception

                                                                                                                                 * Mixed feelings on whether the meal kit provides a sufficient advantage over a standard grocery trip. Initial skepticism on cost and delivery cadence.

                                                                                                                                 * Positive view of the benefit for audiences, especially for difficult-to-source or expensive ingredients.









	Marketing and Reframing: 

                                                                                                                                 * Clearly market the cost savings and value compared to standard grocery shopping to address customer affordability concerns and perceived wastefulness.

                                                                                                                                 * Focus the promotion narrative on the recipe/dish being fulfilled, rather than a general brand partnership.

	Katheryn Eckles

	V. Recipe Quality and Vetting

                                                                                                                                 * Influencers expect HelloFresh to vet recipes (internal developers test them for quality and taste) due to concerns about varied quality in a marketplace setting.

	Quality Control (QC) & Trust Building: 

                                                                                                                                 * HelloFresh must take responsibility for recipe quality to protect the brand.

                                                                                                                                 * If full vetting is not possible, a highly visible and searchable review and rating system (e.g., filter by 4/5 stars) is essential for customers to "self-select into quality."

	Operations





	VI. Targeting and Creator Profile

                                                                                                                                 * Current interviewees may be content creators first ("smoking mirrors") and not "recipe people." Recruitment of cookbook authors has been difficult.

	Recruitment Strategy: 

                                                                                                                                 * Target "food people," especially cookbook authors, who are more likely to have makeable, high-quality, and evergreen recipes.

                                                                                                                                 * Leverage cookbook publishers for author access and interviews. Highlight the platform's value as proof of engagement for future brand deals ("X customers bought my recipes").

	Katheryn Eckles

	VII. Brand Ecosystem and Engagement

                                                                                                                                 * Creators expect the meal kit to be an extension of their brand (logo, links).

                                                                                                                                 * Desire for clarity on the timing from recipe submission to fulfillment to time promotions effectively.

	Platform Functionality: 

                                                                                                                                 * Enable features that support the influencer's brand and community engagement.

                                                                                                                                 * Support the concept of "live cookalongs" or episodic events, where the meal kit enables mass participation, boosting community and live engagement.

	Annette MvdE

	VIII. Trend-Chasing vs. True Creation

                                                                                                                                 * Smaller influencers tend to be more trend-related, while all feel pressure to participate in trending recipes (e.g., "Dubai chocolate").

	Product Strategy: 

                                                                                                                                 * While expecting trends, the platform must allow for diverse content and focus on evergreen recipes.

                                                                                                                                 * Marc suggested a clearer definition of a "trend" is needed (ingredient vs. recipe type) for actionable insights.

	Annette MvdE

	IX. Recipe Aggregation & Monetization Scale

                                                                                                                                 * The goal is for customers to order recipes, menus, or meal plans from various creators and HelloFresh (aggregation).

	Long-Term Vision: 

                                                                                                                                 * Position the platform as a storefront or reverse marketplace with massive potential.

                                                                                                                                 * Emphasize the global growth and reach opportunity for influencers, as the company's fulfillment capacity is "next level."

	Annette MvdE

	X. Ingredient Quality and Cost Control

                                                                                                                                 * Influencers want detailed info on ingredient quality, stock availability, and brand names to ensure consistency between their video and the delivered box.

	Process and Cost Education:

                                                                                                                                 *  Educate creators on logistical and cost constraints.

                                                                                                                                 * For initial big players, consider allowing kitchen visits to build trust. Educate creators on how to limit expensive ingredients to maintain a competitive meal cost and take rate.

The goal of this session is to review our current insights and get your advice on the next steps forward. Initial interviews with creators, surveys of customers and prospects, and secondary research have provided us with comprehensive insights into various assumptions: 



                                                                                                                                       * Where do we see the highest risks? 

                                                                                                                                       * Where do we need to gain deeper insights for the MVP vs. the vision?

                                                                                                                                       * Where to stop/pivot?

Ian Brooks Jama Musse

2. What we know / don‚Äôt know today and directions to move forward





First signals:





üßë‚Äçüé§ Recipe Creators Insights  (3 Interviews)

	 Image of  



	Biggest challenges are the algorithm, time & effort

                                                                                                                                          * The algorithm is a major challenge, constantly changing across platforms, making it difficult to stay visible. 

                                                                                                                                          * Even when users follow someone, they may go weeks without seeing their content. Keeping up with platform-specific trends, trending audios, and frequent algorithm updates adds to the complexity.

                                                                                                                                          * Editing and adapting videos to meet the unique requirements of each platform is demanding and time-consuming, especially when managing multiple channels.

                                                                                                                                          * Another key pain point is the ongoing need to generate fresh ideas and stay on top of emerging

	The platform needs to be seamless and low effort for influencer, including



                                                                                                                                          * Minimizing manual effort, users want the ability to import recipes directly from the creator‚Äôs website into the HelloFresh portal, eliminating the need to retype content.

	 Image of  







	Seek Data & Analytics to learn and adapt

Creators lack visibility into what content or recipes resonate most with users. While not always stated directly, their struggle to identify trends and understand audience interest suggests a need for clearer, data-driven guidance. 

Access to metrics like top-selling recipes, conversion rates, and quality feedback would help them make more informed decisions about what to create next.

	                                                                                                                                          * Develop a creator-facing analytics dashboard that highlights trending content, best-performing recipes, and user engagement insights, similar to TikTok‚Äôs Creator Search Insights. This would give creators the data they need to stay aligned with user demand, optimize their content strategy, and reduce guesswork.





	 Image of  







	Mixed feelings on value proposition

                                                                                                                                          * Across interviews, creators expressed mixed feelings about the value proposition, particularly around cost, delivery cadence, and whether meal kits offer enough advantage over a standard grocery trip.

                                                                                                                                          * However, a consistent sentiment emerged: they believe the service would deliver strong value to their audiences, especially when it includes hard-to-source or expensive ingredients (e.g., pistachio paste for the viral Dubai chocolate trend). This suggests creators see clear audience benefits even if they personally weigh the trade-offs.

	                                                                                                                                          *  Emphasize and communicate the unique value delivered to audiences, such as access to specialty ingredients, convenience, and the ability to recreate trends easily. 

                                                                                                                                          * Consider pricing transparency and flexible delivery options to strengthen creators‚Äô confidence in promoting the kits, ensuring the offering feels compelling compared to typical grocery shopping.





Current Gap

                                                                                                                                          * Is a model centered on rare ingredients enough to justify the price and effort, or would audiences expect a broader range of recipe types similar to a traditional meal kit subscription?

                                                                                                                                          * How often do creators believe their audiences actually want specialty or trend-driven recipes versus more accessible, everyday options?





                                                                                                                                          * How important is it for them to independently create these meal kits in a new platform (and manage this additional platform ) vs. working with us in a brand partnership?

	  



	Cohesive brand ecosystem

There is an expectation to treat the creator's meal kit as a special, easy-to-use extension of their brand. 



To keep followers engaged, the kit must feel authentic. 

                                                                                                                                          * include the creator‚Äôs logo

                                                                                                                                          * Experience back to digital space: e.g. QR code for an exclusive tip video or back to their content

                                                                                                                                          * Value seen in integrated "Live" Cook-Alongs with synchronized delivery

	                                                                                                                                          * Time is a key challenge for the influencers,so  we need to make sure this platform doesn't become another task for an extra video content creation (missing skus, tips and tricks)

                                                                                                                                          * Operations: talking to Melanie Schwind, there are possibilities to re-brand e.g. the Mealcard or using a neutral box instead

	  



	Ingredients are key: Quality, selection and transparency

                                                                                                                                          * The system must be completely honest with creators and customers (ingredient substitutions and quality). If the kit has to use a slightly different kind of cheese than the one in the video, the creator must be able to tell the customer upfront to keep their trust. (quality is critical, especially for recipes with few ingredients.)





Vetting recipes

                                                                                                                                          * Most creators' first expectation was that we would vet the recipes for quality control (ingredients are available). 

                                                                                                                                          * If the expectation is that the creators vet their own recipes, one mentioned that different creators may have different quality standards (i.e. testing a recipe 5 times vs. making it once before posting).

                                                                                                                                          * Suggested a "test run" and access to research on what customers are buying.

	Questions to Operations: 

                                                                                                                                          * What's the level of transparency on sku‚Äôs we can provide?





                                                                                                                                          * We need to make sure to offer alternatives of ingredients with transparent information of brand quality (Gap: what are the specific metrics they are looking for?)

	 Image of  







	Fair Revenue Model

                                                                                                                                          * Most creators expect a revenue model that includes both a promotional fee and a commission on each sale, viewing this as a fair exchange for their effort. 

                                                                                                                                          * However, not all creators share this view: one preferred a flat-rate payment similar to traditional brand deals, expressing uncertainty about sales volume and concern that generating meaningful revenue would require substantial posting. This reveals a spectrum of comfort levels with performance-based compensation and highlights the need to address creators‚Äô confidence in the product‚Äôs sell-through potential.

Customer side

                                                                                                                                          * Program must be priced reasonably and accessible for "everyday" use and suggesting additional financial incentives (50% off, free dessert) to convince users to buy

	                                                                                                                                          * Offer flexible compensation models to meet different creator preferences, such as a hybrid structure (flat fee + commission) or a strictly flat-rate option. 

                                                                                                                                          * Additionally, provide clear sales forecasting, audience fit insights, or promotional support to help creators feel more confident that their efforts will translate into meaningful sales without excessive posting pressure.

	Value-Prop

There is a significant "Inspiration-Execution-Gap" in consumer cooking behavior, particularly among the Efficient Inspired segment, who frequently seek meal inspiration online, especially from social media food influencers (primarily on YouTube and Instagram) but often save rather than successfully execute the recipes.

	Gap:

                                                                                                                                          * Purchase behaviour: what are the occasions to purchase such a meal kit? How often? Does it matter what kind of recipe? How is the relationship towards the influencer influencing this?

                                                                                                                                          * Influencer shop vs. Marketplace: would you buy it from the same creator? Would you be interested in others as well?

                                                                                                                                          * Viability: What would you be willing to pay for this?

	 Image of  







	Needs/Barriers

Success in an Influencer Marketplace hinges on building and maintaining consumer trust, which is driven by authenticity, relatability, and professionalism rather than just expertise. 

While influencers are valued for their real-life relatability, barriers such as recipe inaccuracy, sponsorship skepticism, and fear of social commerce scams can inhibit engagement and purchase.

                                                                                                                                          * High skepticism toward sponsored content (-> authenticity) 

                                                                                                                                          * E.g. On Reddit, people frequently raise doubts about how genuine recipe creators are, particularly when brand sponsorships are involved.

                                                                                                                                          * Fear of recipe failure  (-> robust vetting)

                                                                                                                                          * Some creators are perceived as lacking "professionalism," admitting to only testing recipes once or twice. Many users distrust recipes from TikTok/Instagram until they are "vetted by other sources first." 

                                                                                                                                          * Concerns about transaction trust (> transparent logistics) in social commerce





	To address these challenges, the strategy should focus on:

                                                                                                                                          * Implementing robust quality control and vetting of recipes, including repeat testing, standardized instructions, and transparency.

                                                                                                                                          * Incorporate social proof (reviews, ratings, friends‚Äô activity) to reinforce trust and immediacy

                                                                                                                                          * Promote interactive content, like polls or quizzes, that naturally lead users to relevant products.



                                                                                                                                             * Delivering ‚Äúedutainment‚Äù content that combines entertainment with practical guidance and skill-building.



Gap: Test live-stream shopping events or shoppable stories to combine entertainment and purchase.

	 Image of  







	Seamless purchase

The key appeal of social commerce lies in ease, convenience, and low-friction purchasing, allowing consumers to move seamlessly from product discovery to checkout. 





Platforms that reduce navigation and integrate in-app purchasing are driving higher engagement and conversion, as users value immediate access and personalized buying options.

Key insights:

                                                                                                                                                * Low-effort purchasing drives adoption: 28‚Äì32% of social media shoppers transact because it‚Äôs easy, familiar, and enables instant purchase upon discovery.



                                                                                                                                                * Seamless in-app payment accelerates conversion: Nearly 30% of users complete purchases via stored payment methods or credit cards without leaving the app, emphasizing the importance of integrated checkout.



                                                                                                                                                * Platform-specific mechanisms matter: TikTok and Meta offer strong in-app shopping experiences, while YouTube and Pinterest require redirection or third-party integration, impacting conversion potential.

                                                                                                                                                   * Tiktoks shop is not available in canada as today



                                                                                                                                                      * Personalization and immediacy enhance appeal: Limited-time offers, exclusive drops, and live-stream shopping create urgency and leverage social engagement to encourage purchases.





	How can we make sure we offer a seamless purchase experience?





                                                                                                                                                      * Platform-Specific Strategies

TikTok & Meta: Maximize in-app purchasing by using native shops, live streams, and shopping stickers.

                                                                                                                                                         * For platforms that don‚Äôt yet support in-app purchasing in your market (e.g., TikTok Shop in Canada), provide quick redirects with minimal steps to maintain a near-seamless experience.

                                                                                                                                                         * YouTube & Pinterest: Optimize redirect flows with pre-filled carts and ensure mobile optimization to minimize drop-offs.





                                                                                                                                                         * Implement one-click checkout and stored payment methods wherever possible to reduce friction.

                                                                                                                                                         * Guest check-out

                                                                                                                                                         * OTP

                                                                                                                                                         * Minimize the number of clicks from discovery ‚Üí cart ‚Üí checkout.

                                                                                                                                                         * Offer digital wallets, credit/debit cards, and local payment solutions to accommodate diverse audiences.

Strategic directions: Reason why



We believe in a B2B2C marketplace that allows

                                                                                                                                                         * recipe creators to use HF‚Äôs operational system to create and sell meal kits independently and promote them via social media channels in order to use a new revenue stream and connect with their followers



                                                                                                                                                         * Prospects, to purchase recipes from their favourite influencers as meal kits with high quality ingredients, next day delivery to their home with OTP, to being able to cook them easily



                                                                                                                                                         * HF Actives, to purchase recipes from different food influencers in their weekly subscriptions that strengthens their value and variety perception in the service





The main difference we see between the MVP (left) and the bigger vision (right) is the level of control: 

                                                                                                                                                            * with the MVP we having the highest control: creating recipes together with 3‚Äì5 big/medium chefs/influencers, vet the recipes quality before making them purchasable



                                                                                                                                                            * An iteration could mean more control: testing a ‚ÄòHF vetted‚Äô stamp feature, where many influencers can create their recipes, some might be vetted, others not



                                                                                                                                                            * Towards an open marketplace: where everyone can create recipes but we need to make sure to bring some kind of quality insurance (vetted/review based quality check, ‚Ä¶)



  



  











Q: What is our major goal?

Do we actually need a standalone vertical to unlock this new monetization opportunity, or can we achieve similar outcomes, highly personalized content, new revenue streams, creator partnerships within or adjacent to our current systems with significantly less operational and technical complexity?

	Kick-Off Summary: HelloFresh Creator Marketplace

Original Transcript

Vision

Transform HelloFresh from a meal-kit provider into a universal food fulfillment platform: the ‚ÄúSpotify for food.‚Äù

 A place where any creator, customer, or institution can share a recipe that HelloFresh fulfills with precision and freshness.

[Shift: ‚ÄúCreated by HelloFresh‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúFulfilled by HelloFresh.‚Äù]

1. Strategic opportunity

                                                                                                                                                                     * Consumers already save and share recipes on TikTok, Instagram, and Pinterest, but rarely cook them

                                                                                                                                                                     * HelloFresh can bridge digital inspiration and real-world execution, leveraging its operational excellence in sourcing, portioning, and delivery

                                                                                                                                                                     * Long-term vision: any recipe online could be orderable via HelloFresh (a ‚ÄúCook with HelloFresh‚Äù button across the web)



2. Who could be a Creator?

Four core creator types define the opportunity:

                                                                                                                                                                        1. Customers / Home cooks: share personal or family recipes.

                                                                                                                                                                        2. Public creators / influencers: expand reach and drive cultural relevance.

                                                                                                                                                                        3. Institutional content owners: NYT Cooking, Epicurious, etc.

                                                                                                                                                                        4. AI-generated recipes: emerging content category for experimentation.



3. Platform strategy: Early Stage vs. Long-term





Early Stage: Pilot

Run parallel pilots (e.g., influencer-only model vs. open model) to see what works before scaling or hardwiring it into the core business.

                                                                                                                                                                           * Curated creator onboarding: Only work with selected ‚Äúwhale‚Äù influencers or trusted creators at first, to ensure content quality and avoid PR risk

                                                                                                                                                                           * Quality assurance and trust focus: HelloFresh keeps control over what recipes go live, testing operational feasibility and brand impact

                                                                                                                                                                           * Modular, testable pilots: First pilots must be modular and reversible and ‚Äúno one-way doors  so the team can learn fast and adjust the model (test small, learn, and iterate)





Long Term

Once the platform is validated

                                                                                                                                                                           * Open, scalable marketplace: platform shouldn‚Äôt stay curated forever, it should become an open ‚Äúcreator platform‚Äù where anyone (customers, influencers, institutions, even AI) can upload recipes, similar to Spotify or YouTube

                                                                                                                                                                           * Customer ratings and transparency: Instead of HelloFresh manually approving recipes, the community‚Äôs reviews and ratings would determine which recipes succeed, shifting accountability from HelloFresh to creators

                                                                                                                                                                           * Ubiquitous ‚Äòfulfilled by HelloFresh‚Äô ecosystem: The long-term ambition is that recipes across the internet could be instantly fulfilled by HelloFresh, a ‚ÄúCook with HelloFresh‚Äù button on any recipe site.





4. Considerations: Brand & Trust

Risks (Joanna GCI):

                                                                                                                                                                           * Quality inconsistency could erode HelloFresh‚Äôs premium brand

                                                                                                                                                                           * Customers associate the HelloFresh name with trust and reliability; unclear content sourcing could confuse.

Mitigations:

                                                                                                                                                                           * Pilot in Canada (4% of revenue) for controlled learning.

                                                                                                                                                                           * Maintain HelloFresh-verified recipes alongside creator content.

                                                                                                                                                                           * Clear labeling and customer feedback loops to ensure transparency.



5. Customer Insights (Katheryn Eckles)



Unmoderated Concept Test with 31 participants (15 prospects, 16 actives)

                                                                                                                                                                              * 97% positive reaction in early testing

                                                                                                                                                                              * Viewed as modern, convenient, and innovative

                                                                                                                                                                              * Users expect HelloFresh to vet recipes and creators, strong brand trust carries over

                                                                                                                                                                              * Key motivations: variety, convenience, and the ability to cook social-media recipes easily

                                                                                                                                                                              * Concerns: recipe reliability and ingredient accuracy



6. Competitive Context

                                                                                                                                                                                 * Platforms like Instacart, NYT Cooking, and TikTok Shop are moving into ‚Äúshop by recipe‚Äù experiences.

                                                                                                                                                                                 * HelloFresh‚Äôs portion control + fulfillment quality remain unique advantages.

                                                                                                                                                                                 * Speed to market is essential to secure category leadership.





7. Execution Path

                                                                                                                                                                                 * Build modular, testable pilots with distinct models (influencer-only, open, institutional).

                                                                                                                                                                                 * Focus on operational feasibility, customer trust, and scalable tech architecture.

                                                                                                                                                                                 * Create a cross-functional ‚Äúcreator platform‚Äù team spanning tech, marketing, operations, and brand.

                                                                                                                                                                                 * Pilot readiness: explore Canada launch to validate model economics and risk management.



8. Strategic Imperative

The HelloFresh Creator Marketplace redefines the company‚Äôs role in the food ecosystem from a meal kit provider to a platform powering the global creator economy for food. 

Ian: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not in the business of creating recipes, we‚Äôre in the business of making them real.‚Äù

                                                                                                                                                                                    * The algorithm is a major challenge, constantly changing across platforms, making it difficult to stay visible. 

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Even when users follow someone, they may go weeks without seeing their content. Keeping up with platform-specific trends, trending audios, and frequent algorithm updates adds to the complexity.

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Editing and adapting videos to meet the unique requirements of each platform is demanding and time-consuming, especially when managing multiple channels.

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Another key pain point is the ongoing need to generate fresh ideas and stay on top of emerging

	The platform needs to be seamless and low effort for influencer, including



                                                                                                                                                                                    * Minimizing manual effort, users want the ability to import recipes directly from the creator‚Äôs website into the HelloFresh portal, eliminating the need to retype content.

	 Image of  







	Seek Data & Analytics to learn and adapt

Creators lack visibility into what content or recipes resonate most with users. While not always stated directly, their struggle to identify trends and understand audience interest suggests a need for clearer, data-driven guidance. 

Access to metrics like top-selling recipes, conversion rates, and quality feedback would help them make more informed decisions about what to create next.

	                                                                                                                                                                                    * Develop a creator-facing analytics dashboard that highlights trending content, best-performing recipes, and user engagement insights, similar to TikTok‚Äôs Creator Search Insights. This would give creators the data they need to stay aligned with user demand, optimize their content strategy, and reduce guesswork.





	 Image of  







	Mixed feelings on value proposition

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Across interviews, creators expressed mixed feelings about the value proposition, particularly around cost, delivery cadence, and whether meal kits offer enough advantage over a standard grocery trip.

                                                                                                                                                                                    * However, a consistent sentiment emerged: they believe the service would deliver strong value to their audiences, especially when it includes hard-to-source or expensive ingredients (e.g., pistachio paste for the viral Dubai chocolate trend). This suggests creators see clear audience benefits even if they personally weigh the trade-offs.

	                                                                                                                                                                                    *  Emphasize and communicate the unique value delivered to audiences, such as access to specialty ingredients, convenience, and the ability to recreate trends easily. 

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Consider pricing transparency and flexible delivery options to strengthen creators‚Äô confidence in promoting the kits, ensuring the offering feels compelling compared to typical grocery shopping.





Current Gap

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Is a model centered on rare ingredients enough to justify the price and effort, or would audiences expect a broader range of recipe types similar to a traditional meal kit subscription?

                                                                                                                                                                                    * How often do creators believe their audiences actually want specialty or trend-driven recipes versus more accessible, everyday options?





                                                                                                                                                                                    * How important is it for them to independently create these meal kits in a new platform (and manage this additional platform ) vs. working with us in a brand partnership?

	  



	Cohesive brand ecosystem

There is an expectation to treat the creator's meal kit as a special, easy-to-use extension of their brand. 



To keep followers engaged, the kit must feel authentic. 

                                                                                                                                                                                    * include the creator‚Äôs logo

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Experience back to digital space: e.g. QR code for an exclusive tip video or back to their content

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Value seen in integrated "Live" Cook-Alongs with synchronized delivery

	                                                                                                                                                                                    * Time is a key challenge for the influencers,so  we need to make sure this platform doesn't become another task for an extra video content creation (missing skus, tips and tricks)

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Operations: talking to Melanie Schwind, there are possibilities to re-brand e.g. the Mealcard or using a neutral box instead

	  



	Ingredients are key: Quality, selection and transparency

                                                                                                                                                                                    * The system must be completely honest with creators and customers (ingredient substitutions and quality). If the kit has to use a slightly different kind of cheese than the one in the video, the creator must be able to tell the customer upfront to keep their trust. (quality is critical, especially for recipes with few ingredients.)





Vetting recipes

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Most creators' first expectation was that we would vet the recipes for quality control (ingredients are available). 

                                                                                                                                                                                    * If the expectation is that the creators vet their own recipes, one mentioned that different creators may have different quality standards (i.e. testing a recipe 5 times vs. making it once before posting).

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Suggested a "test run" and access to research on what customers are buying.

	Questions to Operations: 

                                                                                                                                                                                    * What's the level of transparency on sku‚Äôs we can provide?





                                                                                                                                                                                    * We need to make sure to offer alternatives of ingredients with transparent information of brand quality (Gap: what are the specific metrics they are looking for?)

	 Image of  







	Fair Revenue Model

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Most creators expect a revenue model that includes both a promotional fee and a commission on each sale, viewing this as a fair exchange for their effort. 

                                                                                                                                                                                    * However, not all creators share this view: one preferred a flat-rate payment similar to traditional brand deals, expressing uncertainty about sales volume and concern that generating meaningful revenue would require substantial posting. This reveals a spectrum of comfort levels with performance-based compensation and highlights the need to address creators‚Äô confidence in the product‚Äôs sell-through potential.

Customer side

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Program must be priced reasonably and accessible for "everyday" use and suggesting additional financial incentives (50% off, free dessert) to convince users to buy

	                                                                                                                                                                                    * Offer flexible compensation models to meet different creator preferences, such as a hybrid structure (flat fee + commission) or a strictly flat-rate option. 

                                                                                                                                                                                    * Additionally, provide clear sales forecasting, audience fit insights, or promotional support to help creators feel more confident that their efforts will translate into meaningful sales without excessive posting pressure.
